definition: kimono/Japanese: traditional national clothing, as opposed to Western clothing 洋服
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: The young women are dressed in kimonos and the young men are in suits and ties.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻的女人穿和服和少年的男子在西装和领带。

sentences.english: The kimono had to be picked up at the boutique.
sentences.chinese: 但必须亲自去到那家专卖店才能拿到和服。

sentences.english: Following and serving the Lord is good.
Don’t you think kimonos are beautiful?
Both of policewomen and female prisoners had a basic knowledge of AIDS/HIV.
sentences.chinese: 干警和服教人员对艾滋病相关基础知识掌握均较好。

sentences.english: Sometimes later, I found a photo of a rock star dressed in a Kimono.
sentences.chinese: 后来，我看到一张摇滚明星身着和服的照片。

sentences.english: Frankly, I think kimono as beautiful as other traditional national costume.
sentences.chinese: 坦白地说，和服和其他的民族服饰一样的漂亮。
和服是日本的民族服装。

sentences.english: At one time, Japanese people wore kimonos for casual and formal occasions.
sentences.chinese: 曾经，日本人在非正式和正式场合都穿和服。

sentences.english: Under her long red kimono she toted a forty-four gun.
sentences.chinese: 在她的红和服下藏有一把四四式手枪。

sentences.english: Yes, sir, the kimonos are extra.
Kimono Condoms surpass international standards for durability and strength.
sentences.chinese: 和服安全套在耐久性与韧性上已超过了国际标准。

sentences.english: Imaged the ancient people wearing the Japanese KIMONO.
sentences.chinese: 想象着古代的人们穿着和服。

sentences.english: This is what we often see the kimono behind the decorations.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们常看到的和服背后的装饰品。

sentences.english: Kimono is the national costume of Japan.
Kimonos made of fabrics such as cotton and polyester generally reflect a more casual style.
sentences.chinese: 其他布料的和服，如棉质或涤纶和服，相对比较休闲。

definition: geisha (Japanese female entertainer)/also written 藝妓|艺妓[yi4 ji4]
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
